reviews.review_msg: Amy was very disrespectful toward students. She also was disorganized in terms of assignments and expectations, would not recommend to anyone.

I don't recommend taking this class if you are Indigenous. This course is catered towards non-Indigenous, future-educators who don't have a strong background in Indigenous-Canadian history/are nervous teaching Indigenous history and pedagogy. If that is you, then this course is a great start in Indigenous teaching principals :)

Going to class is mandatory since there is a participation mark. Just some writing to do for this class but the class content is very fun. Any made the class very worth learning in an interesting way. Respected of students and listen to what students want to say. Highly recommend this class as a GPA booster!

I did not like this prof. I like to read truth with facts, references and evidence, not stories told for me to believe without proof. She didn't teach that much, in class we talked about what we thought, then she would correct you. She gave more time to the students who agreed with the ignorants who wrote the papers very bad not university material
as long as you go to every class and keep up with the readings you'll be fine =)
omg are you serious? i'm taking that class right now...how bad is it? she fail ppl on the essays?

She is not who I thought she would be..horrible teacher, one that is intolerant of others and inconsiderate. I have a 3.74 GPA..I am a very objective person..take it from me as hard as it is to trust me, and lose the skepticism..dont take the course unless you want a bad grade..I never knew of it, until now. It isnt spite; rather truth. You choose?
